channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Cancer doesn't care': Patients pushed past divisive politics to lobby Congress
item.description: Hundreds of volunteer advocates put partisan differences aside and pressed Congress to help people with cancer. The advocacy came just before the stal...

item.title: Curtis Sliwa Has the Spotlight. He’s Not About to Give It Up.
item.description: Mr. Sliwa, the Republican nominee for mayor of New York City, finds himself a major player in the race. He’s under heavy pressure to drop out.

item.title: Cuomo Proposes That New York City Take Partial Control of Subway
item.description: Andrew Cuomo, whose stewardship of the M.T.A. as governor was contentious, suggested that the authority hand over responsibility for capital construct...

item.title: This School Has Taught Native Hawaiians Since 1887. Is That Discrimination?
item.description: The admissions policy of Kamehameha Schools gives preference to Native Hawaiians. A new lawsuit calls it “blood-based discrimination.”

item.title: Tech CEOs say the era of 'code by AI' is here. Some software engineers are skeptical
item.description: While AI is increasingly used to write code, every line is still reviewed by humans. Some engineers complain about having to clean up AI-generated cod...

item.title: Latest Trump-Zelensky Meeting Yields No Progress Toward a Cease-fire in Ukraine
item.description: A contentious meeting between President Trump and President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine produced no obvious progress toward a cease-fire.

item.title: Some ant architects design a colony to cut the risk of disease. Humans, take note!
item.description: One kind of tiny ant can serve as a monumental example for how to keep members of a community safe from pathogens. A new study shows how they do it.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery Says It Is Considering a Sale
item.description: The owner of CNN, HBO and the Warner Bros. movie studio revealed that it has received acquisition interest from multiple suitors.

item.title: A theory why the internet is going down the toilet
item.description: A new book diagnoses a sickness affecting some of America's biggest companies.

item.title: Shutdown to impact federal workers' pay. And, tensions grow between U.S. and Colombia
item.description: Some federal employees may not receive a paycheck this Friday due to the government shutdown. And, tensions between Colombia and the U.S. continue to ...

item.title: Latest Trump-Zelensky Meeting Yields No Progress Toward a Cease-fire in Ukraine
item.description: A contentious meeting between President Trump and President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine produced no obvious progress toward a cease-fire.

item.title: France Sends Former President Nicolas Sarkozy to Prison to Start 5-Year Sentence
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, the president of France from 2007 to 2012, received a five-year sentence after being convicted in a campaign finance scandal.

item.title: Suspect Charged in Paris Museum Heist (No, Not That One)
item.description: A woman from China was charged with stealing gold last month from National Museum of Natural History. It’s one of several high-profile recent thefts f...

item.title: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy Is Imprisoned
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, the president of France from 2007 to 2012, began a five-year prison term after he was found guilty of conspiring to seek funding from...

item.title: Vance Lands in Israel as U.S. Tries to Shore Up Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: With the cease-fire deal under strain, Vice President JD Vance is set to meet with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other leaders.
